The Berkeley Hotel Pratunam
8.1 Excellent
Based on 27365 reviews

Booked this hotel and requested for a large bed, including no corner rooms and no rooms near the staircase.

When we checked in, they said that the large bed are no longer available as the rooms are fully booked. It's quite disappointing but we just went ahead to our room. It's at the north wing so we had to walk quite a distance to change the lift. We chose a smoking room but the smell was too damn strong so we decided to change to a non-smoking room. So once we got to our new room, I was shocked that they gave us a corner room + it's just beside the staircase. :/ They gave us the total opposite of what we wanted! So we had to walk over to the other lift down to the lobby and change room again by ourselves. They told us to return the previous room key once we changed the room. They should at least help by accompanying us and just collect the key so we do not have to walk back and forth? It is a "5-star hotel" for goodness sake... So at our newest room, there was a patch of idk what on the floor. It looks like blood but I guess it's just some coffee. The wall looks dirty as well. Bad cleanliness. :( My boyfriend and I then decided take a walk outside the hotel after putting our stuff in the room. It looked like it was gonna rain so we borrowed an umbrella from the concierge. We walked in to a convenient store to buy some stuff. While leaving, it was pouring outside. Thank goodness we had an umbrella right? But oh wow, while walking under the rain with the umbrella our hair got wet because the umbrella had holes. Thanks for the umbrella bitch. I still wonder why is this a 5-star hotel with many good reviews. I feel so cheated and this hotel has the worst service ever. Book this hotel at your own risk!!

Show more
Penny , Singapore
Modena by Fraser Bangkok
8.8 Excellent
Based on 1234 reviews

We were disappointed when we arrived at the airport with no one from the hotel picking us up. It is clear during our booking through Agoda that we were opt for pick up service.

Anyway, we end up taking a taxi by ourselves after waited for sometimes. Upon check-in, the staffs were not able to communicate with us in English. As such, they were not able to explain to me what happen to the pick-up service. We did hope that the hotel manager or someone could explain it to us but sadly none of them able to. The room and facilities are GREAT only lacking of swimming pool but we can make do without it. Upon our 3rd night, the access card was malfunctioning. When we asked the front desk to re-program the card, they asked me for the confirmation of our stay. They asked for our Agoda booking confirmation and proof of payment. THIS IS HORRIBLE! They should have checked their system before asking this to the existing guest. We did show them our booking but they were not able to answer as to why they are not able to find our name in their system. Upon check-out, again, the front desk staff made a horrible mistake by charging us 1 count of breakfast (for 2 pax) which has been fully paid during check-in. We had the invoice and when we shown them, again, none of the staffs are able to answer us. I would strongly suggest Fraser to make an effort to retrain their staffs in terms of the system, SOP as well as communication skill. Overall, we are quite happy with the hotel.

Show more
Sutanto , Indonesia
Grande Centre Point Hotel Terminal 21
8.6 Excellent
Based on 11994 reviews

It was pouring in BKK during my stay. Fortunate we stayed at T21 as it's connected with Asok BTS and Sukhumvit MRT.

Healthland within walkable distance. Even if you don't want to walk, Let's Relax is accessible through the hotel elevator. One thing I would comment was I booked a room with 3 single beds coz I was traveling with my family. However the room was not available when we check in. They upgraded us to a Suit with the extra bed set in the living room while the other two beds are in the bedroom. The bedroom was too small for us to open the luggages -- but leaving all luggages in the living room is not convenient too coz the bathroom is next to the bedroom. The Suit itself is very nice and spacious but that's not what we need -- that is why I choose and paid a 3 single bed room. Having said that, I will defiant stay at T21 again because of its wonderful location.

Show more
MAN , Hong Kong
Grande Centre Point Hotel Ratchadamri
8.6 Excellent
Based on 9822 reviews

My family and I enjoyed our 5 nights stay at Grande Centre Point Ratchadamri. The room is nice and classic with good view.

Bed is comfortable but only issue I have is the pillow being too thick for my liking. Would like to comment on this waiter serving at the breakfast area for his good service, very attentive and welcoming - Chai. The chef who prepares kway teow soup also remembers my husband's order without bean sprout which makes it heart warming. Wide spread of breakfast. We specially love the free flow of coffee and hot chocolate made available at the hall. Location is close to Ratchadamri BTS (5min) and Chit Lom BTS (10min). Overall quite convenient. We will definitely be back on our next trip to Bangkok!

Show more
Mei , Singapore
Baiyoke Sky Hotel
7.6 Very good
Based on 21994 reviews

Pros - only good is the convenient location: near Pratuman market and train station Cons -Room is dimmed and furniture are old.

- Breakfast very limited variety. - Bathtub and shower are separated, if dip in bathtub, still need to wet the floor and walk to shower area to rinse yourself, because there is no shower head near bathtub. - stayed 4nights in hotel, on 2nd night, found some tops purchased during the day missing. Remembered clearly that it was not lost along the way cos even tried in while back in the room. On the last night, even packed 10boxers in a bag while packing the luggage before going out for massage around 10pm. Did not check again while checking out, found them missing too. So do lock your belongings when you get out of the room! - Poor room service: cable network not working, called reception twice and was transferred to room service, but after more than an hour, tv still not working and no updates from them either.

Show more
Jerlyn , Singapore
Arnoma Grand
7.6 Very good
Based on 9618 reviews

Overall it is value for money. The location is very convenient as it is next to big C, opposite Central World, walking distance to pratunam famous chicken rice & pratunam market and chitlom BTS station.

Room a bit old as the wallpaper started to peel off. But overall room is satisfied as AC, hot water are good in function. I want to highlight the new completed covered pedestrain link bridge is the most "like" thing as we are travelled with baby with stroller. it is not safe to walk beside the road. It would be perfect if it can direct link to central world (currently only direct link to platinum mall) and add lifts to several spot for travellers who bring stroller and big luggage. I definitely will consider to stay here again and hopefully by the time the hotel have renovated.

Show more
Kiam , Malaysia
Centre Point Pratunam Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 7328 reviews

Hotel has an excellent location for shopping purpose, the rooms and toilets were big and cozy, these was what I liked most.

It was clean place, sometimes you need to call for making up the rooms but generally was good, the breakfast was moderate as was not up to my expectations. What I really don't like is I have booked the hotel in February and I traveled in August, I booked 5 rooms, there was a recommendation to have the rooms all in one floor as we were gruop of three families, when I reached the hotel there was nothing ready and put us in different floors and asked for deposit to f 5000 Thai Batt for each room!? Just imagining that!!? The hotel plot is small, its pool is small with salt water, most of hotel staff were friendly apart of receiptions in my checking in. One last gesture I should say, I asked for late check out and they offered me 2 rooms up to 2 p.m. Advice, if you don't like to wait to go for the rooms, don't book here as hotel has 30 floor and sometimes you need to wait

Show more
Zuhair , Bahrain
Grande Centre Point Sukhumvit 55 Thong Lo
8.8 Excellent
Based on 1072 reviews

We chose this hotel because we wanted to try a new location in Bangkok, as we always stay in Terminal 21, and this is a fairly new hotel.

Unfortunately, we didn't get to try the Onsen. Pros - access to tuk tuk shuttle was convenient to the BTS station. I believe it's every 20 mins. The rooms and bathroom were clean and new. Our particular room (Triple Room) was quite small for the 3 of us, so I can't speak about the other rooms. Toiletries were ample, but quality was so-so if you're picky about shampoo, etc. Breakfast spread was abundant and expansive. It feels quite indulging to be honest. Great selection and lots of stations. Nice to wake up to this. The setting was white colonial..very soothing and pleasant. Loved the mango sticky rice station and Hot Ginger Tea. The steam room, sauna was nice to use. Locker rooms were available, but lacks any toiletries in the changing room, such as hair brush, deodorant, lotion, slippers, etc. So, bring your own, or do it in your room. Most of all, the staff was extremely friendly, specifically their Social Media coordinator or Manager. I had accidentally left/forgot my silver ring in the lobby bathroom and they found it and kept it for me to pick up. We chatted over Facebook messenger. Extremely prompt response and attentive. Very helpful!! So, thank you for that. Japanese toilets of course, always a plus. Overall, a positive experience.

Show more
YVETTE , United States
Grande Centre Point Hotel Ploenchit
8.4 Excellent
Based on 5816 reviews

Location is unbeatable. At the airport we were told we needed 2 taxis for our family of five so we decided to take the airport bus A1 that dropped us at the BTS station to take the sky train and get off at ploen chit Very convenient! Only about 72 Baht pp combined.

The reception was friendly, welcoming and professional. Lobby clean and spacious, room is a little small but very clean. Bed very comfortable. Bathroom is relatively large for room size but hot water was slow to come so I took cold shower everyday. Did not really mind because the weather was hot a humid. We were on 17th floor with a balcony and the view was awesome. Breakfast was excellent we liked everything they had. At other times we visited the many malls nearby and had dinner or lunch. They have a whole foods look alike supermarket in Central Mall and it was a great display of different types if fruits you don't see in the West. Very convenient! Wish we could stay longer. Reminds me of Hyatt or Sheraton in US.

Show more
quynhnga , United States
Chatrium Hotel Riverside Bangkok
8.7 Excellent
Based on 8875 reviews

We had a room with a river view. The view was marvelous but the room, though large was unexceptional.

The carpet looked rather worn and the instant coffee that was replenished every morning was pretty awful. The room unexpectedly included a small, but adequate kitchenette. A convenience store and other shops were very accessible so cooking would have been a viable option. Breakfast, added on when we checked into the hotel, was a bit pricey (500 THB per person per day) but was truly exceptional--a selection of bread, rolls, etc., eggs any style, omelets made to order, the standard accompaniments such as sausages, bacon, hash browns , sautéed tomatoes, a variety of fruit juices, cereals (includiy congee, plus a wide selection of dishes from other cuisines which might include sushi, noodle dishes, Indian curries, soups and more. Worth the extra price if you had a big appetite. Food in the Chinese restaurant (Silver Wave) was mediocre and concierge service tended to be a bit snooty.

Show more
Ardeshir , United States
Siam Kempinski Hotel Bangkok
9.1 Exceptional
Based on 1489 reviews

This is my third time staying in Kempinski Siam hotel and everytime we feel very happy to stay in this hotel but only this time the service at the breakfast restaurant(near Siam Paragon entrance) wasn't really good.

Actually we can go up to 17th floor the club lounge for breakfast due to i booked for two executive rooms. But i wanted to try the restaurant. The service there not really that good. Two days, we ordered fried eggs abd waited for more than 20 minutes and when asked for the eggs we orfered, the only replied i get from the service lady is "i ordered" and walked away. I understand there were many guests especially from China and maybe thr service staff was busy with many orders but did i just said "service" and hopefully she know what is the meaning of "service". Everything was good except for the above that i mentioned.

Show more
Kheang , Cambodia
Emporium Suites by Chatrium
8.4 Excellent
Based on 3503 reviews

Located in the center of Sukhumvit, the hotel sits atop shopping malls Emporium and Em-Quartier. Both malls have plenty of luxury as well as high-street brands.

Em-Quartier has a very nice food court in the ground floor, with lots of great options for a reasonably priced meal. All the rooms of the hotel are located above the 20th floor and offer amazing views of the city. We were actually looking down on Hilton's rooftop from our 37th floor Studio. The room and bathroom was subtly luxurious and tastefully decorated. The fitness centre is well equipped, well-maintained and clean and there was a yoga class in the morning, while we stayed at the hotel. Pool area is lush little oasis offering respite from the bustle of Bangkok. The breakfast buffet offered something for every taste from croissants to sushi and everything in between. Staff are helpful and attentive and fluent in english.

Show more
Lenike , Denmark
Prince Palace Hotel
7.3 Very good
Based on 12360 reviews

I've stayed dozens of hotels in bkk and this is for sure the most overrated one. It is evident that the building was built before the time or recharable batteries as the entire room has only two plugins.

There is no wifi in the rooms only common areas where the signal is still a circa 1995 1mb/s down. The hotel location is Teri le with zero restaurants within walking distance.. forcing you to pay overpriced costs of in house restaurants or taking a taxi to and from for each meal. Not even the minibar is stocked as the final evidence that they have just simply given up on trying to accommodate guest past a bare minimum. also there are a lot of insects in the room giving you the feeling the entire building is infested.. all in all not an enjoyable stay.. it was my second time staying here and this is the only reason I leave such a bad review.. both rooms were quite bad in all the forementioned remarks.. I won't be staying a 3rd time.. don't be taken in by the relatively lower price.

Show more
Adam , Canada
Asia Hotel Bangkok
7.6 Very good
Based on 13195 reviews

First of All: Warning to all Travelers who stay here: When you get to your room please do inventory of all items in mini bar and fridge and make sure nothing is missing.

We had to pay 60 baht for mineral we that we never took during checkout We and my wife stayed 2 nights (19 - 21 May 2017). Check in process was OK. The hotel was a little old but clean. For some reason, the interior designer doesn't light bright lights. The room and some places in the hotel need more lighting. Feels like I was in a Christopher Nolan movie. The wifi signal was very bad inside the room. I had to stand next to the room door to get a signal. Food at breakfast was OK with pork items clearly labelled. The hotel has direct access to Ranchathewi BTS station so that was convenient. You could also walk (700 meters) to MBK and Siam Discovery shopping mall. A 7-11 is located near the hotel also. Now the worst part: the checkout process took 30 minutes. During checkout, The girl behind the front desk keep answering phones and entertaining some event organizer who was trying to get a new key for one of his clients. Basically. ignoring me. After all this the house keeping staff has to check the room first and this is were they found out a bottle of mineral water was missing from the mini bar. Because we had a plane to catch, I just paid the 60 baht and didn't argue further eventhough we never took it. To summarize: Will I be staying here again? NO. There are better and newer hotels in the Siam - Sukhomvit area

Show more
Rudyanto , Indonesia
Centara Grand at Central World Hotel
8.5 Excellent
Based on 7532 reviews

The hotel is lovely with a good location. The malls are very close (Siam Paragon, Platinum Mall, etc.

), and the hotel is actually connected to the Central World mall. Because of its location, food options, standard shopping, and quick errands are a breeze. The breakfast buffet is lovely, although the spread can be better. The coffee and tea are a treat; they are really very good. The rooms are very curiously laid out; it is always interesting to stay in rooms that are visually interesting. The lifts can be a bit slow during busy times; then again, I was there during a three-day party, so the traffic may have been unusually high. The food is good; I spent a lot of my time ordering room service. I even had friends over because they liked the food. The service in the hotel was amazing. The staff was always attentive, and genuinely wanted my stay to be comfortable. The survey they sent out asking for feedback in the middle of my stay was very helpful; I provided feedback, and they immediately took action. I appreciate the appropriate attention they gave my feedback. It really made my stay immensely better. I had one incident when a tuktuk driver was charging an unreasonable amount, and the person at the door (I think his name is Kai) helped me manage the situation. He was very skillful and genuinely helpful. I wish I could recall the names of the staff, because they were all very, very helpful. The people at the reception desk, the bellboys, the floor staff, the people cleaning my room, the people who served food in my room, the restaurant staff, all of them were really very good. The service at the hotel was so good.

Show more
Doni , Philippines
Dream Hotel Bangkok
8.4 Excellent
Based on 7653 reviews

I stayed at the Dream hotel for 5 nights (July 13-18). The last time I stayed at this hotel was about 5 years ago! I was pleasantly surprised to see the hotel in such good condition, being nearly the same as it was 5 years ago.

It should be noted that the Dream hotel consists of 2 buildings (Dream 1 and 2). I stayed in Dream 2 in a deluxe room (not large in size but suitable for 1-2 persons), which has the pool and the gym, but not the restaurant, which is in Dream 1. Below are some other positive aspects of this hotel: 1. Great location-- about a 5-10-minute walk to the Asoke BTS station and Terminal 21 mall. 2. There are numerous restaurants, stores and massage shops in walking distance, and thanks to the BTS system, it’s extremely fast and easy to get around to many areas in Bangkok. Further, you can take the BTS to the Phaya Thai station and then take the Airport City Link to Suvarnabhumi airport. The total time with the BTS and Airport Link is about 1 hour. Taxi would be about 40 minutes in normal traffic. 3. Good value for your money (I paid around 14,000 baht for 5 nights that included breakfast). Keep in mind this is low season. 4. Gym, spa and pool. 5. Buffet breakfast was included in my price and was decent (nothing super). 6. The bell hops and guards who helped you cross the street were wonderful. 7. Fairly quick check-in and check-out service but no express or pre-check-out system. 8. Free shuttle service to the Asoke BTS station/Terminal 21 shopping mall. 9. Internet was fast and stable. Negative aspects of the hotel. 1. The reception staff members, to my surprise, are not very friendly, and try to avoid eye contact whenever I passed by, apparently to avoid having to say hello. 2. On the 3rd day the electricity was shut-off from around 09.00-14.30 because Bangkok city was making some repairs/upgrades in the area. I think the hotel should inform their guests of this when they book, so the guest can decide whether to stay or book another hotel, at lea

Show more
leslie , Sweden
Shangri-La Hotel, Bangkok
9 Excellent
Based on 2575 reviews

Great Experienced Location is ok, need to walk a bit of distance to get food, nothing fancy around the hotel Clean and well maintained Breakfast is good and as expected but not as many varieties as Singapore Shangri-La.

Staff - friendly and especially to toddler, very helpful and initiate to assist, good in English. Not so good experience At first, there's free shuttle bus to MBK and free shuttle boat to Asiatique. When we arrived that day, during the check in period they said the contract for those free shuttle bus/boat has ended, hence there's no free shuttle to anywhere. later a bit when we ask for the map from concierge, they said the the shuttle boat to Asiatique is available from tomorrow onward. You may need to call and confirm if you rely on the free shuttle to travel to those places.

Show more
CHEE , Malaysia
Arte Hotel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 1259 reviews

Hotel's location is quite good...5 mins walk to Terminal 21 but not soundproof.. Was given a corner unit with 2 rooms door quite close.

. during midnight / early morning you can heard the next door occupant closing their door loudly. Request a high level as we booked a premier double room. We got there around 11am BKK time and they said that currently high level is not available for check in, asked to come back at 2pm BKK time.. so my husband and I went for lunch and some shopping.. Around 3pm BKK time we went back to the hotel, they assigned us level 1.. which is the same as what they initially wanted to give us.. I told them that I was told to come back after 2pm.. They say best level is 2 due to hotel is fully booked.. On the day of our check out, the hotel quoted us 500baht for Taxi to Survarnabhumi Airport and I rejected as I request to have the taxi to go by meter, the hotel staff say ok, will help us arrange.. This was a great place to stay as a solo traveler. The owners were very welcoming and helpful, and the room felt like an oasis in the city.

I loved the deck right off the room where I could watch the river traffic go by. It's also very close to the Grand Palace and Wat Pho and Wat Arun, just a few minutes by river boat which is a delightful way to travel. My favorite thing about Ibrik was the neighborhood, which is quiet and non-touristy. The temple at the end of the street is gorgeous, and frequented by neighbors and monks and friendly kids, not tourists. I enjoyed joining in the morning and evening services there. There is also a local market one block away with food and cheap, gorgeous clothes. Two restaurants right next door, both with outdoor decks to eat by the river. The closest is beautiful and upscale and relaxing, with mediocre food (I thought, after one meal); the second is dressed-down, family-owned, and the owners are friendly and take good care of you if you have a cold! I also enjoyed the breakfast on the deck. You decide the night before what you want (Western breakfast items) and what time. Halfway through breakfast they brought a bonus course of fresh mango. Really nice way to start the day. Also: the bed was supportive and comfortable, and the air conditioning welcome in the 98-degree heat. And there's a mini bar (non-alcoholic) in the room for convenient snacking. One thing to note: at night there are a lot of party cruise boats that go by, so if you go to bed early you'll hear music intermittently. I found this charming, but if you want a quieter room there's one that doesn't face the river (you can still hang out on the deck).

Bang Phlat is not an obvious choice to stay in Bangkok but now that we've done it I can highly recommend it as its a real Thai neighbourhood somewhat off the beaten track.

Bang Phlat itself is a 10-15 minute bus ride (6 baht, an experience in itself) from Khao San And Rambutree or you can catch a water bus by the Ratchawithi bridge and travel all the way down to Thon Buri and the temples at Wat Arun. Stick food (deep fried food on sticks) rules along the busy Charon Sanitwong road which runs through Bang and street vendors also sell the local delicious iced tea cha yen, made with ice, strong red tea leaves and evaporated and condensed milk. The Bang Phlat Resort however is a hidden gem of comfort, tranquility and luxury in this bustling neighbourhood of Bangkok. Bang Phlat resorts quaint traditional wooden houses boast two double bed rooms each (ground floor and first floor) with bathroom, air conditioning, free wi-fi and beautiful wooden furniture. Breakfast options consist of Thai rice soup with either chicken or shrimp, both of which are delicious or alternatively American breakfast is available. Tesco Lotus is virtually opposite the entrance to the hotel and there's a small shopping mall with some restaurants should you want something more substantial to break your fast.

We stayed for two nights in the Arun Suite at the Arun Residence in the Old City of Bangkok. It's true that the view of the Wat Arun across the river, especially at night, is stunning.

However, one cannot live on the view alone. There were two major issues. First, we could not get a cab driver to take us directly to this hotel. We asked countless cabs only to have them firmly shake their head no and drive off. They simply won't go. So we asked to take us to the Wat Pho, which is nearby the hotel, and while they would at least agree to take us there, none would take us using the meter and all wanted an inflated flat rate. So when you have luggage or it's raining or it's late at night, this really, really sucks. And it didn't matter having the card the hotel gives you that has the hotel name and address written in Thai. None of the cabs would take us to this hotel. There is no BTS Skytrain or MRT subway stop close by either. You have to take a ferry down the river to the Central Pier to get to a Skytrain stop (Taksin). This takes a lot of time and costs as much as a taxi, if you can get one. Second, the Arun suite has significant maintenance issues. The toilet button didn't work, so we had to take the toilet tank lid off and depress the flush trigger every time we went to the bathroom. The shower door wouldn't close all the way, so every time we showered, a lot of water leaked out and left the bathroom mat completely soaked. The TV would not work with "No Signal" on every station. And one of the pillowcases had a stain that looked like someone had a nosebleed. Housekeeping never changed it - so gross. When you call the front desk, they don't answer. So we went down to the lobby to let them know about these issues. Nothing but the TV issue was fixed during our stay. Ridiculous! While the hotel is a unique experience, it's not the kind of experience I want in the future or can recommend to anyone who wants a toilet that functions properly for the premium you're paying.

It was a little uncomfortable having to come back to stuffy rooms as once you leave the room and take your key card from the slot the power goes off. Had some fruit juice one evening before going off for a massage and they were lovely. Of course a little pricier than out on the streets but still cheap for western travelers. Overall I really liked the stay but for the price we paid, it was really too much... felt like a more luxurious Pulau Ubin (a singapore offshore island) island stay. would not recommend dining there for dinner because you will be SWARMED with sandflies. the mosquito coils that the staff burned didn't help much- both my boyfriend and I had multiple bites... food was quite tasty though, so it was a pity the experience was lacklustre. Breakfast on the other hand was fairly pleasant, with little/no disturbance from insects. On other thing- it can get a bit noisy with all the speedboats/boats roaring late into the night, and starting really early in the morning. if you decide to stay be sure to stay on a weekend and visit the floating market and also go for a bike tour with Paul. No need to pay extra for the room with a view or the family nest. You can easily take photos of these two without staying there, and they're definitely not worth the price

My boyfriend and I stayed here for two nights on a weekend outing to Bangkok, and we loved it! We were looking for something cheap and near the sights we wanted to see.

9 Excellent
Based on 79 reviews

We took a risk to stay in this very new B&B with hardly any reviews, but were very pleasantly surprised.

Location wise, it is just within a couple of hundred metres at most from Saphan Taksin BTS and the boat piers - very convenient for going almost anywhere in BKK by almost any mode of transport! The house has a lot of history over a hundred years, and it has been newly restored and converted to a B&B. It is family run and the service is great and very personal, they even take you on a 'tour' to explain the history of the house. Breakfast is served in a nicely restored dining room or by the open yard and is freshly prepared like homemade food only when you arrive. The meals though simple are nice - more like eating in someone's home than the run-off-the-mill stuff you get at many hotels. The rooms have high ceilings and all the furniture is custom made and new. They have a few minor hiccups as with any new place, but I'm sure they will sort this out in no time. Only major negative is the location is beside a highway so it can be a bit noisy - this was not a problem for us but light sleepers may find this a challenge. At this price it is great value and we enjoyed out stay. IMHO it's a real gem of an accommodation in BKK.

Simon , Iceland
Lullaby Inn Silom
8.5 Excellent
Based on 284 reviews

When we arrived we were very politely greeted at the front desk where we were quickly checked in and given a couple glasses of orange juice while we waited.

The room met our expectations and more. The bathroom has a dedicated shower stall with a built in soap and shampoo dispenser. The bed was perfect, not too hard and not too soft. We slept great all three nights we stayed there. Additionally, the room included a fridge, two complimentary bottles of water each day, a television with both Thai and English channels, a small desk with a wooden chair, and a wardrobe with a small valuables safe in it. There is no smoking in the hotel so there is no smell. The rooms are cleaned on a daily basis. We only heard other residents on one or two occasions. The doors to the hall are relatively thin so if a noisy group comes by you will likely hear them. We could, on occasion, faintly hear water running in another room, though it was too faint to tell if it was the floor above us or one of the rooms to the side. Either way, it was not a disturbance. The hotel does have a 2100-0700 quiet time. Each morning there is an all you can eat breakfast of cold cereal, toast, fruits, yogurt, coffee, orange juice, and your choice of scrambled or fried eggs and bacon or sausage. The only catch, all of that is NOT included with the room as we thought it was. For what is included, I thought it was quite reasonable at 100 baht per person per day. The location of the Lullaby Inn is perfect, right next to the heart of the upscale Silom district. The main street has a night market set up every evening with all the clothes and trinkets you could possibly want along with the typical street food vendors. Additionally, it is only a five walk between the hotel and then Chong Nonsi sky train station that will give access to the east Bangkok train line.

Traveler impressions of Bangkok

Bangkok is a huge city and there are a lot of landmarks that are a must see: grand palace, wats (budhist temples), markets,.

.. but the public transportation is very complicated. The distances are too huge to go walking, but the bus stops don't say the routes of the buses, the underground or skytrain only covers less than half of the city... so you must use taxi or tuk-tuk. Food and public transport is very cheap. Use the ferry to go to Grand Palace, and have a drink at Soi Rambuttri (next to Khao San road). Jim Thompson house is very peculiar, yet not cheap. Go to a floating market and to Ayutthaya, about one hour or two away from the city, unmissable.

Bangkok is a vibrant city that maintains the Thai culture and combines it with the advance of shopping experience (be it luxury or street goods). Wat Pho (Sleeping Buddha) is a must see place with its historical value and artistic architecture, or you can take a ride along Chao Phraya River via the piers nearby Saphan Thaksin BTS Station. The street food is great too, and if you want to, try out the food courts in the shopping malls. You can shop till you drop in Bangkok. If you like luxury goods, you can shop in Gaysorn Mall, Siam Paragorn and Central World. And if you looking for bargain, then you can always go to the night markets (Pratunam, Chatuchak and China Town).

More about Bangkok

Bangkok is the capital of Thailand, and serves as a gateway for this region. Bangkok is served by Suvarnabhumi International Airport , which is one of the busiest and most important travel hubs in Asia, as well as the regional Don Muang Airport, which serves many of the regional airlines. Hotels in Bang Na are popular with travelers making quick stopovers as the area is within close proximity of the international airport.

Bangkok is a diverse and sprawling city without a dedicated central district. Instead, the major activity follows the major roads of Sukhumvit and Silom through the length of the metropolis. Visitors to this city will have endless options for accommodations, shopping, and some of the most exciting nightlife in Southeast Asia. 

Getting around Bangkok used to be tricky, but modern infrastructure changes and the use of sky trains continues to make transportation easier.

The cosmopolitan energy in Bangkok is exhilarating, but it's easy to see that this city also plays an integral role in Thai culture and history. No sooner do tourists round the corner of a brand-new skyscraper than they come face-to-face with a centuries-old temple or an eclectic open-air market. The city features many unforgettable sites such as the Temple of Dawn, the Grand Palace and Wat Phra Kaew, which is known as the Temple of the Emerald Buddha. Bangkok remains endlessly fascinating and surprising even to its residents. There’s much more to see and learn about Bangkok, and the interactive map on this page is a great way to continue uncovering all the important landmarks, hotels, and attractions of this vibrant city.

Bangkok is served by Suvarnabhumi International Airport , which is one of the busiest and most important travel hubs in Asia, as well as the regional Don Muang Airport, which serves many of the regional airlines. Hotels in Bang Na are popular with travelers making quick stopovers as the area is within close proximity of the international airport. Bangkok is a diverse and sprawling city without a dedicated central district. Instead, the major activity follows the major roads of Sukhumvit and Silom through the length of the metropolis. Visitors to this city will have endless options for accommodations, shopping, and some of the most exciting nightlife in Southeast Asia. Getting around Bangkok used to be tricky, but modern infrastructure changes and the use of sky trains continues to make transportation easier. The cosmopolitan energy in Bangkok is exhilarating, but it's easy to see that this city also plays an integral role in Thai culture and history. No sooner do tourists round the corner of a brand-new skyscraper than they come face-to-face with a centuries-old temple or an eclectic open-air market. The city features many unforgettable sites such as the Temple of Dawn, the Grand Palace and Wat Phra Kaew , which is known as the Temple of the Emerald Buddha. Bangkok remains endlessly fascinating and surprising even to its residents. There’s much more to see and learn about Bangkok, and the interactive map on this page is a great way to continue uncovering all the important landmarks, hotels, and attractions of this vibrant city.
